text: Just recently, a number of times I (and other customers) could not find shopping baskets outside the entrance. It feels a bit too weird and awkward taking empty baskets from behind the cashier or from stacks of baskets used for holding the covers of items outside. Attached is the photo where there are 2 points of baskets and the one left at each point is attached to the wheels.

Selling rotten pears on the shelf. Incorrigible services. Their service staff intentionally hid away the rotten side of one of the pear and sold them to consumers. My mum only discovered the rotten pear after unwrapping them. The pictures below say a thousand words

A good place to shop. However, as the space is small, you may not find stuff you get from bigger supermarkets. Usually you'll see staff members doing unpacking of goods and make the place too crowded to shop. Staff members are helpful and efficient though.

Hiding inside HDB blocks, right next to PIE, 1st thought it should be a small size neighborhood super market. It surprised me, turn out to be a big store.

When I said big, means products that it sell are lots, and can easily meet anyone needs, took a simple example is that it even sell charcoal for BBQ...thumps upüëç
They have most of the products that I need for lessons (kids), found it!
